sect1.title: State Propagation
sect1.para: State propagation is an important part of the item state concept. Its the part of the internals that tell parent items (and views) that a state has changed and views can easily act on this notification (eg. cancel current redraw requests and resume them once the canvas is ready).
sect1.formalpara: State Signalling State propagation is quite easy. It's all handled in the CcItem class. States can be (un)set per view. If the style changes for a view, the parent item picks up this change and changes its own state. This mechanism is executed synchronously (but might be changed to a very high priority idle handler).

sect1.title: Collecting
sect1.para: CCC is supposed to get a feature called Item Clustering. The state of updating the clusters will be specifyable.

sect1.title: Size Requests
sect1.para: Size requests are not yet implemented in CCC. But the state of managing size requests and size allocations will be specifyable.

sect1.title: Preparing
sect1.para: Not every item will update every detail just when an internal attribute changes (eg. the text item doesn't update the caret position immediately once the cursor position changes).
Items in this state shouldn't be drawn as they are in an intermediate state that needs to be passed to be renderable.
